Functions

util_queue_sync_insert
[Queue References]

Functions

void util_queue_sync_insert (handle_t section, util_queue_t *queue, void *object)

Function Documentation

void util_queue_sync_insert ( handle_t  section,
util_queue_t *  queue,
void *  object 
)

The util_queue_sync_insert routine inserts an object into the queue synchronous. Inserting an object is blocked for other processes or threads at this time. The object will always be referenced as the last object of the queue (FIFO).

NOTE: All objects which have to be queued requires a simple void pointer (void*). This pointer is the first element of the object and will be used by the queue to handle the references to the next object of the queue (referenced list).

Parameters:
section references critical section (see OSAL documentation).
queue Specifies the queue resource.
object points to an object which have to be inserted.
See also:
util_queue_sync_query
